verses.verse: Then <S%H464>Eliphaz<s%> the <S%H8489>Temanite<s%> <S%H6030>answered,<s%>
"If someone <S%H5254>ventures<s%> to <S%H1697>talk<s%> with <S%H3811>you,<s%> will you be grieved? But who <S%H3201>can<s%> <S%H6113>withhold<s%> himself from <S%H4405>speaking?<s%>
<S%H3256>Behold,<s%> you have instructed <S%H7227>many,<s%> you have <S%H2388>strengthened<s%> the <S%H7504>weak<s%> <S%H3027>hands.<s%>
Your <S%H4405>words<s%> have <S%H6965>supported<s%> him who was <S%H3782>falling,<s%> You have made <S%H553>firm<s%> the <S%H3766>feeble<s%> <S%H1290>knees.<s%>
But now it has <S%H935>come<s%> to <S%H3811>you,<s%> and you faint. It <S%H5060>touches<s%> <S%H926>you,<s%> and you are troubled.
<S%H3374>Isn't<s%> your piety your <S%H3690>confidence?<s%> <S%H8537>Isn't<s%> the integrity of your <S%H1870>ways<s%> your <S%H8615>hope?<s%>
<S%H2142>"Remember,<s%> <S%H6>now,<s%> whoever perished, being <S%H5355>innocent?<s%> Or <S%H375>where<s%> were the <S%H3477>upright<s%> cut <S%H3582>off?<s%>
According to what I have <S%H7200>seen,<s%> those who <S%H2790>plow<s%> <S%H205>iniquity,<s%> and <S%H2232>sow<s%> <S%H5999>trouble,<s%> reap the <S%H7114>same.<s%>
By the <S%H5397>breath<s%> of <S%H433>God<s%> they <S%H6>perish.<s%> By the <S%H7307>blast<s%> of his <S%H639>anger<s%> are they <S%H3615>consumed.<s%>
The <S%H7581>roaring<s%> of the <S%H738>lion,<s%> and the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the fierce <S%H7826>lion,<s%> the <S%H8127>teeth<s%> of the young <S%H3715>lions,<s%> are <S%H5421>broken.<s%>
The old <S%H3918>lion<s%> <S%H6>perishes<s%> for <S%H1097>lack<s%> of <S%H2964>prey.<s%> The <S%H1121>cubs<s%> of the <S%H3833>lioness<s%> are scattered <S%H6504>abroad.<s%>
"Now a <S%H1697>thing<s%> was secretly <S%H1589>brought<s%> to <S%H241>me.<s%> My ear <S%H3947>received<s%> a whisper of <S%H8102>it.<s%>
In <S%H5587>thoughts<s%> from the <S%H2384>visions<s%> of the <S%H3915>night,<s%> when deep <S%H8639>sleep<s%> <S%H5307>falls<s%> on <S%H582>men,<s%>
<S%H6343>fear<s%> <S%H7122>came<s%> on <S%H7461>me,<s%> and trembling, which made <S%H7230>all<s%> my <S%H6106>bones<s%> <S%H6342>shake.<s%>
Then a <S%H7307>spirit<s%> <S%H2498>passed<s%> before my <S%H6440>face.<s%> The <S%H8185>hair<s%> of my <S%H1320>flesh<s%> stood <S%H5568>up.<s%>

It stood <S%H5975>still,<s%> but I <S%H5234>couldn't<s%> discern its <S%H4758>appearance.<s%> A <S%H4758>form<s%> was before my <S%H5869>eyes.<s%> <S%H1827>Silence,<s%> then I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H6963>voice,<s%> saying,
<S%H582><s%> 'Shall mortal man be more <S%H6663>just<s%> than <S%H433>God?<s%> Shall a <S%H1397>man<s%> be more <S%H2891>pure<s%> than his <S%H6213>Maker?<s%>
<S%H539>Behold,<s%> he puts no trust in his <S%H5650>servants.<s%> He <S%H7760>charges<s%> his <S%H4397>angels<s%> with <S%H8417>error.<s%>

How much <S%H637>more,<s%> those who <S%H7931>dwell<s%> in <S%H1004>houses<s%> of <S%H2563>clay,<s%> whose <S%H3247>foundation<s%> is in the <S%H6083>dust,<s%> who are <S%H1792>crushed<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H6211>moth!<s%>
Between <S%H1242>morning<s%> and <S%H6153>evening<s%> they are <S%H3807>destroyed.<s%> They <S%H6>perish<s%> <S%H5331>forever<s%> without any regarding <S%H7760>it.<s%>
<S%H3499>Isn't<s%> their tent cord <S%H5265>plucked<s%> up within <S%H4191>them?<s%> They die, and that without <S%H2451>wisdom.<s%>'
